content:
Sure, here are some of the sources used in the market sizing exercise:

1. Number of small businesses in the US: According to the Small Business Administration (SBA), there were 31.7 million small businesses in the US in 2020. Source: SBA.gov, "Small Business Trends" (<https://www.sba.gov/business-data-and-statistics/small-business-trends>)
2. Percentage of SMBs that use YouTube channel management tools: There is no specific data available on this, so we made an assumption of 5% based on industry knowledge and research.
3. Estimated spend per year per organization: We estimated that small businesses using YouTube channel management tools spend around $3,000 per year on average based on industry research and knowledge.
4. Percentage of SMBs interested in YouTube channel management tools: There is no specific data available on this, so we made an assumption of 20% based on industry knowledge and research.
5. Percentage of SMBs that are not already using a YouTube channel management tool: There is no specific data available on this, so we made an assumption of 80% based on industry knowledge and research.
6. Estimated percentage of SAM that a particular YouTube channel management tool provider can realistically capture: We estimated that a provider can realistically capture 10% of the SAM based on industry research and knowledge.
7. Estimated spend per year per organization for SOM: We estimated that businesses in the target market segment spend around $2,000 per year on average based on industry research and knowledge.

Please note that these are assumptions based on industry knowledge and research, and may not be entirely accurate.
